image.altText: A large body of blue water within a reservior

props.synopsis: SA Water — which is owned by the SA government — has been fined for polluting the waterways with grey clay silt when draining the Warren Reservoir, in the Barossa Valley, in May 2023.

title.children: SA Water fined $60k for botched reservoir maintenance that sent sludge into waterways

image.altText: A man with black dreadlocks wearing a white basketball jersey and shorts dribbles a basketball down a court

props.synopsis: The Adelaide 36ers terminate Montrezl Harrell's contract while he serves a provisional ban after testing positive for an illicit substance.

title.children: Montrezl Harrell dropped by 36ers while doping ban continues

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding up a phone, with an incoming call from a mysterious hooded figure.

props.synopsis: Individuals who contact a survivor of abuse or personal injury without their permission to encourage them to make a claim for compensation could face fines of up to $50,000 under new laws which have passed in South Australia.

title.children: 'Claim farmers' face fines of up to $50,000 under new SA laws

image.altText: A man in a suit stands behind a lectern with media microphones on it. To his left is a woman holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: South Australia's Premier says the government is grappling with whether it should give daily updates on the bloom's location during summer, and says it has been "actively engaged" in conversations with the federal government since its emergence.

title.children: SA government grapples with whether it should issue daily bloom updates during summer

image.altText: A large truck carrying neatly piled wood logs enters a large yard with thousands of large wooden logs.

props.synopsis: With biofuels earmarked as a way to power the transport sector in the future, one industry says its waste can be converted into aviation and shipping fuel.

title.children: Ambitious plan to convert forestry waste into fuel for ships and planes

image.altText: An older couple with their heads close together, smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Robert Hall was killed when he was struck by partially blind driver John Charles Robertson on the Horrocks Highway in 2018. It has been a long wait for the family ahead of the release of coronial findings into his death next month.

title.children: Family's anger at seven-year coronial inquest wait

image.altText: An SA police vehicle

props.synopsis: South Australia Police says a Vale Park man has been charged following a pursuit that led STAR group officers and police negotiators to a unit in Adelaide's western suburbs.

title.children: Man to face court over incident involving STAR officers

image.altText: Optus sign in front of a building

props.synopsis: The Singapore government's sovereign wealth investment vehicle is the majority owner of Singtel, which owns Australia's second-largest telco provider.

title.children: Singapore's PM is Optus's majority shareholder. Here's why that could be a problem

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: A childcare centre in Adelaide's inner south-west has been ordered to close for two weeks after being handed an emergency action notice following claims children were left unsupervised.

title.children: Childcare centre temporarily shut amid claims children were left unsupervised

image.altText: Mohammad Shareed Hotak - man with dark hair in green shirt

props.synopsis: The Fair Work Commission has ordered Uber to repay lost wages to a driver it deemed was unfairly deactivated from the rideshare platform.

title.children: Uber ordered to pay lost wages in 'landmark' unfair deactivation case

image.altText: A UTS building in the background with torn pieces of paper scattered over the top with words from reports written on them

props.synopsis: The National Student Ombudsman is investigating allegations UTS failed to improve its response to sexual harm and gender-based violence despite four reviews since 2022.

title.children: UTS students say they regret reporting sexual harassment as ombudsman investigates

image.altText: Bright yellow canola flowers in a paddock fill the frame.

props.synopsis: Selfie hunters seeking the perfect social media photo among flowering canola are putting their safety and growers' livelihoods at risk, farmers say.

title.children: Farmers notice more canola crop trespassers wandering into paddocks

image.altText: A Flinders University sign on a glass wall.

props.synopsis: Six internationally recognised marine scientists who are researching South Australia's toxic algal bloom are set to lose their jobs at Flinders University, the ABC understands.

title.children: Flinders University jobs under threat as news of proposed restructure spreads

image.altText: Black and white photo of two people smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian kitchen manufacturer says a scammer has tried to extort money to remove several fake one-star reviews posted to Google.

title.children: SA business asked to pay $US200 to remove fake one-star Google reviews

image.altText: Woman with smallish, white, fluffy dog sitting on her lap as she reclines on the couch

props.synopsis: In the same way Apple and Samsung used different phone chargers, many clean tech products are not compatible with others. Experts say it is a big problem for the energy transition.

title.children: The phone charger conundrum: Warning about standards in clean tech

image.altText: An illustration shows several people's face and AI is taking jobs

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is coming for our jobs — but will it take them away, or just give us a powerful new assistant?

title.children: 'Waiting for the axe to fall': Fears for jobs in AI boom

image.altText: A red and white sign which reads MS with South Australia & Northern Territory underneath in black letters

props.synopsis: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.

title.children: Non-profit multiple sclerosis support agency in voluntary administration

image.altText: Anthony Albanese speaks at the UN podium.

props.synopsis: The prime minister uses his UN speech to talk up Australia's emissions plan after Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", and confirms Australia is still seeking a temporary seat on the body's security council.

title.children: Albanese addresses UN on climate, Gaza and a security council bid

image.altText: A Macquarie sign.

props.synopsis: Macquarie commits to repaying thousands of Australians who invested hundreds of millions of their retirement savings in the collapsed Shield Master Fund amid admissions it contravened the Corporations Act.

title.children: Macquarie coughs up $321 million payout after superannuation failures

image.altText: Lachie Neale high fives fans watching Brisbane's training session

props.synopsis: Brisbane's co-captain returns just weeks after doctors gave him as little as a five per cent chance of featuring in his third straight grand final as Geelong welcomes back a familiar face to take the place of Tom Stewart.

title.children: Neale completes extraordinary recovery to make Brisbane's AFL grand final team

image.altText: A driver uses a mobile phone in black and white image.

props.synopsis: Queensland's transport department uses AI in its cameras to detect mobile and seatbelt offences, but a new audit has ordered called for a review into how that's done.

title.children: Ethical risks of AI's use in traffic offences raised in new report

image.altText: Students walking in carpark, campus sign in foreground

props.synopsis: Investigations have found 5,340 current and former University of Wollongong employees between 2014 and 2024 have been underpaid wages and superannuation amounting to $6.6 million.

title.children: University ordered to pay millions in underpaid staff wages, super

image.altText: Anne Dunne standing in a hallway.

props.synopsis: Arts industry leaders say creative tax form is needed to create greater opportunities for Australian artists.

title.children: Warning that theatre in Australia is on verge of collapse

image.altText: a close-up of a woman drinking a glass of water. she's wearing gold hoop earrings

props.synopsis: Gympie scraps fluoride from its water supply and becomes the third region in Queensland to reject the practice in just over a year.

title.children: Experts alarmed as Qld council votes to remove fluoride from water supply

image.altText: A photo of a young girl

props.synopsis: Three-year-old Dio Kemp was taken to Monash Medical Centre four times over 10 days before she died of sepsis.

title.children: Monash Health provided unreasonable care before toddler death, coroner finds

image.altText: A close-up of a man with dark hair, looking towards the ground.

props.synopsis: Matt Wright’s lawyers have confirmed they will file a notice of appeal within the next 48 hours, indicating it will be based on five different grounds.

title.children: Celebrity croc wrangler Matt Wright to appeal guilty verdict on five grounds

image.altText: A man celebrates after winning a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Ten years to the day since his first moment in the spotlight, Nicho Hynes returns to AAMI Park for the most important game of his NRL career.

title.children: Nicho Hynes returns to where it all began for the biggest game of his NRL career

image.altText: A woman wears a device on her head with two pads that send electrodes into her brain.

props.synopsis: Some international users of Flow Neuroscience's device have labelled the wearable tech as a game-changer in treating depression, but not everyone is convinced.

title.children: TGA approves a new brain stimulation device for treating depression

image.altText: A motorcycle on its side with a crashed car.

props.synopsis: Super Typhoon Ragasa has killed at least 14 people in Taiwan as it struck the southern Chinese coast.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa slams south China, after lashing Taiwan, Hong Kong

image.altText: a composite image of bradfield candidates Liberal Gisele Kapterian and independent Nicolette Boele

props.synopsis: Gisele Kapterian abandons her court action challenging the election result in the federal Sydney seat of Bradfield.

title.children: Liberal candidate abandons court challenge for key Sydney seat

image.altText: close up of newborn baby with lots of hair breastfeeding

props.synopsis: Last week a breastfeeding mother was asked to leave a Virgin Australia lounge for pumping. Experts says while there is a level of awareness that breastfeeding in public is protected, some people in the community still view it as "inappropriate".

title.children: Why are we still asking mothers to hide breastfeeding?

image.altText: Josh Papalii pictured in action for the Raiders

props.synopsis: The Raiders star's lawyers are asking the ACT Magistrates Court to permanently stay charges against him over a 2024 incident.

title.children: Papalii's lawyers say 'wicked' deleted police chat should stay charges

image.altText: A man wearing a suit, with grey hair smiles slightly

props.synopsis: Nicolas Sarkozy is found guilty of obtaining millions of euros in illegal financing from late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi for his successful 2007 presidential bid.

title.children: Former French president Sarkozy given five-year sentence over Gaddafi case

image.altText: A big sinkhole on a busy Bangkok street with a car teetering on the edge

props.synopsis: Social media footage shows powerlines being pulled down into the 50-metre deep hole and vehicles teetering on the edge.

title.children: Moment sinkhole swallows road in central Bangkok

image.altText: A white and blue police car parked beside a yellow and blue police car.

props.synopsis: The drone flights occurred over several airports across the country throughout the week.

title.children: Denmark says 'professional actor' behind drone flights over multiple airports
